description: From Scots shiel (“hut”) (from Old Norse skjól (“shelter, cover”))  +‎ -ing.. Akin to Danish skjul (“cover”).

entries.meaning: An area of summer pasture used for cattle, sheep etc.
examples: The cattle at Mosfell were kept in a shieling, and Thordis stayed there while the Thing took place.
And what are twenty beds, when all the drovers,And all the shieling herdsmen from Bengorach,Must have a lair provided for the night.
